description: msp-i18n-enabled flag exists in DEFAULT_BOOLEAN_FLAGS with default value false
With flag OFF: standard MSP layout does NOT call getHierarchicalLocaleAction (no locale fetch overhead)
With flag ON: standard MSP layout calls getHierarchicalLocaleAction and passes locale to MspLayoutClient
With flag OFF: standard MspLayoutClient renders children without I18nWrapper (zero behavior change)
With flag ON: standard MspLayoutClient wraps children in I18nWrapper with portal='msp'
With flag OFF: EE MSP layout does NOT call getHierarchicalLocaleAction
With flag ON: EE MSP layout calls getHierarchicalLocaleAction and passes locale to MspLayoutClient
With flag ON: EE MspLayoutClient wraps children in I18nWrapper with portal='msp'
With flag ON: useTranslation() works inside MSP page components (no 'must be used within I18nProvider' error)
MSP onboarding flow still works when flag is ON (I18nWrapper does not break redirect logic)
features/tickets.json exists for all 7 languages (en, fr, es, de, nl, it, pl) with flattened keys
features/projects.json exists for all 7 languages with flattened keys
features/billing.json exists for all 7 languages with flattened keys
features/documents.json exists for all 7 languages with flattened keys
features/appointments.json exists for all 7 languages with flattened keys
Feature namespace files contain flattened keys (no wrapping top-level key like 'tickets')
useTranslation('features/tickets') loads features/tickets.json via http-backend loadPath
client-portal/core.json exists for all 7 languages with nav, dashboard, common, pagination, time keys
client-portal/auth.json exists for all 7 languages with auth and account keys
client-portal/profile.json exists for all 7 languages with profile, clientSettings, notifications keys
All client portal components using tickets.* keys migrated to useTranslation('features/tickets')
All client portal components using projects.* keys migrated to useTranslation('features/projects')
All client portal components using billing.* keys migrated to useTranslation('features/billing')
All client portal components using documents.* keys migrated to useTranslation('features/documents')
All client portal components using appointments.* keys migrated to useTranslation('features/appointments')
All client portal components using nav/dashboard/common/pagination/time keys migrated to useTranslation('client-portal/core')
All client portal components using auth/account keys migrated to useTranslation('client-portal/auth')
All client portal components using profile/clientSettings/notifications keys migrated to useTranslation('client-portal/profile')
Client portal continues working after full migration (no regressions — same translations, new namespace paths)
clientPortal.json removed or emptied after all components migrated — no duplication of keys
msp/core.json exists for English with nav, sidebar, header, and settings keys
msp/core.json nav items match navigation entries in menuConfig.ts
msp/core.json exists for all 6 non-English languages with translated content
useTranslation('msp/core') returns correct English translations when flag is ON
With flag OFF: no language preference section visible in UserProfile (/msp/profile)
With flag ON: LanguagePreference selector appears in UserProfile component
Language selector shows all 7 supported languages plus 'Not set' option (fallback to org default)
Selecting a language in Profile updates user_preferences table (setting_name='locale')
Selecting a language in Profile updates the locale cookie
After selecting a language and reloading, the selected language persists
Selecting 'Not set' clears user preference and falls back to org/system default
With flag OFF: no Language section visible in Settings > General > Organization & Access
With flag ON: MspLanguageSettings section appears in Settings > General > Organization & Access after Teams
MspLanguageSettings shows default language dropdown with all 7 languages
MspLanguageSettings shows enabled languages checkboxes
Changing default language persists to tenant_settings (mspPortal.defaultLocale)
Changing enabled languages persists to tenant_settings (mspPortal.enabledLocales)
getTenantMspLocaleSettings server action reads mspPortal locale settings from tenant_settings
updateTenantMspLocaleSettings server action writes mspPortal locale settings to tenant_settings
Locale resolution for internal users: user preference takes priority over org default
Locale resolution for internal users: org default takes priority over system default when no user preference set
Locale resolution for internal users: falls back to system default when no user or org preference
All new JSON namespace files pass JSON syntax validation (no parse errors)
No duplicate keys exist in any new JSON namespace file
Feature namespace key counts match across all 7 languages (same structure per namespace)
npm run build succeeds with no TypeScript errors after all changes
